comment: Chose this professor for Maymester based on ratings and didn't regret it. The curriculum was broken into modules with video presentations, worksheets, discussion posts (focusing on our thoughts and opinions), and 2 quizzes. The professor provided genuine feedback and appreciated our music experiences and effort. This fast term was enjoyable!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: David Kehler is the professor to take! I've you want an easy Maymester class and he's available do yourself a favor and pick him. The class is easy to follow and follows directly the syllabus. It consists of 4 assignments everyday two 10 quizzes, and two written) it takes no more than 2 hours to complete the module and he's very easy accessible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
TAKE THIS CLASS PLEASE! I thought I'd be spending upwards of 3-4 hours a day on work, instead I got a whole days worth of work done in less then 2 hours. And if you mess up a discussion post, he leave feedback and allows redos. Best Maymester prof ever!!

Thank you Prof Kehler!!

TAKE THIS CLASS! I thought this class was going to be difficult, considering I know nothing about music and it was a may-mester. He was so easy to contact. The work was so easy, it probably took me an hour or 2 to finish it all, I made 100s on everything. The textbook was $60, but it was needed. Pick him if you get the chance you will not regret it

I took this class over the summer and was one of the easiest classes I have taken. I took it online and definitely recommend. The professor did each lesson by module and there were 2 assignments and 2 quizzes in each module. he also had a video and PowerPoint to help you with your worksheets.I really enjoyed this class and ended up with 99!
I had Dr. Kehler for Wind Ensemble. He has high expectations but that's what band is. He's nice and approachable. Always willing to help. His choice in rep. is good too. I liked what I played

Professor Kehler was an amazing professor, and if I was studying music I would certainly take him again. He gives very clear concise direction and his grading is straightforward and fair. You will need to purchase the book and you will have to do some writing in the class but it is not difficult.
